intro: Minuartia recurva var. bigerrensis, commonly known as the rock beard or stonecress, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with a succulent structure that helps it retain water. This variety is often found in alpine and coastal regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
